question: Many childhood diseases can now be prevented through the use of vaccines. Should parents be made by law  to immunize  their children against common diseases or should individuals have the right to choose not to immunize their children?
text: In the present epoch, a tremendous amount of vaccines have been made to against diseases successfully. Some people believe vaccination in every person should be legislated  while some groups of society think immunizing to kids should be decided by their guardians. This argument would not exist if every individual were aware of the benefits and necessity of vaccines thus this essay strongly agrees with making vaccination compulsory by-laws  not only to protect a child himself but also other people in society as well.

On the one hand, humanity has been forced hugely a number of sicknesses in the past, such as smallpox, bird flu, Malaria, and Cholera. Hence, the government should come and take care of minors to get  proper healthcare and immunity.

On the other hand, the germ infected patients are not only harm themselves but also can spread to other persons.
